text:
At Air Canada, we had an older VDI 
platform that needed to be refreshed.

The problem with that platform was 
that it continuously had incidents

which was impacting our contacts and our 
agents. So that's when we chose App Stream.

We had the commitment from AWS that would 
bring us through an aggressive roadmap.

They would bring us to meet 
all our business requirements

and actually more. And at the time, the 
option service wasn't available in Canada,
and that's where Cortex fell into play,

which AWS actually partnered with 
them to deliver the solution.

Cortex has been working with Air 
Canada for the last eight years,

specifically on critical workloads for 
the VDI and desktop infrastructure,

mainly contact centers and other lines 
of business like cargo and maintenance.

When Air Canada decided to renew their call 
center core systems, we knew that we could
play a key role in providing a solution.

That's when we decided to team up with AWS 
and propose the App Stream 2.0 Solution.

Air Canada was looking for a future proof 
solution that would evolve over time.

AWS is strongly committed to their solution 
and demonstrated that they were willing to

develop the features required 
for a seamless operation.

Three main constraints had to be 
balanced to enable an efficient rollout.

User base adoption, technical 
issues, and business timing.

So the balancing act was complex, but 
we managed to get the proper timeline
that satisfied all stakeholders.
AWS has a strong commitment to their partners.
We share the same customer obsession.

More specifically, I believe that 
the quality of communication is core.

As an example, when we have issues, 
the responsiveness that we get from
AWS is incredible.

It dwarfs any technical issue 
that we could encounter.
I feel from my perspective when
I work with AWS is whatever partner they choose,

they'll have the same values, 
the customer obsession.

So, we had the right solution, the 
right partner, and that, for us,
it was just a perfect fit to start this project.
